RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events/Event[System[EventID=1309] and System/Provider/@Name="ASP.NET 4.0.30319.0" and EventData/Data[contains(.,"An unhandled exception")]]
RuleObject.symptom: An Unhandled exception from ASP.NET is detected. The following ASP.NET unhandled exception(s) are detected. %EventDetails%
RuleObject.rootCause: Exceptions in ASP.NET are not handled
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
An unhandled exception means there was a problem occurred and was not handled by your application.
To get this issue resolved, please contact the vendor or developer.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: ASP.NET Unhandled exception detected

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events/Event[System[EventID=1309] and System/Provider/@Name="ASP.NET 4.0.30319.0" and EventData/Data[contains(.,"Request timed out")]]
RuleObject.symptom: Some requests timed out. The following ASP.NET time outs are detected: %EventDetails%
RuleObject.rootCause: ASP.NET request executes for a period of time longer than the maximum timeout period allowed for server-side code execution.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
This kind of issue is typically occurs when the ASP.NET request executes for a period of time longer than the maximum timeout period allowed for server-side code execution. This maximum timeout period can be set by executionTimeout attribute of httpRuntime element in web.config. (The default value is 110 seconds in .Net 4.0)
To get this issue resolved, please contact the vendor or developer.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: ASP.NET requests timed out

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.AnnotationExpression: (EventLogData.Any(EventID == 0 && SourceName == ".NET RunTime" && Strings.Contains("File Change Notification Error")))
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events/Event[System/EventID=0 and System/Provider/@Name=".NET Runtime" and EventData/Data[contains(.,"File Change Notification Error")]]
RuleObject.symptom: Appdomain recycle due to file change. The following events are detected %EventDetails%
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Appdomain recycle due to file change is detected.
Frequent Appdomain recycle can result in performance issue since .Net runtime need to reload all assemblies, re-JIT the code and build the application cache. If you are using in-proc session mode, all sessions lost due to Appdomain recycle. To avoid unnecessary Appdomain recycle, please don't:
* Write application log to the into site folder
* Add or remove Sub-Directories under the site folder
* Modify web.config or Global.asax
* Modify bin folder and binaries under it
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Appdomain recycle due to file change

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.symptom: MS DTC is unable to communicate with MS DTC on a remote system.
RuleObject.rootCause: No common RPC protocol is supported between the two systems.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Please ensure that one or more of the following RPC protocols are common to both systems: TCP/IP, SPX, or NetBEUI.
Most common causes:
- Running out of RPC ports(http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2071425) - Network DTC Access is not enabled ( http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2093429)
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: MS DTC is unable to communicate with MS DTC on a remote system. No common RPC protocol is supported between the two systems.

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.symptom: Consider the following scenario: • You run a Microsoft .NET Framework 3.0-based or .NET Framework 3.5-based Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) service. • The WCF service uses the Net.Tcp Port Sharing Service (Smsvchost.exe) and is hosted on a compute
RuleObject.rootCause: This issue occurs because the Smsvchost.exe process times out after one minute when it tries to transfer an incoming connection request to the W3wp.exe worker process. Additionally, this time-out is non-configurable.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Please install the fix provided in the public KB article to resolve this issue.
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2536617
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: FIX: Smsvchost.exe for the WCF service stops responding when you run a WCF service in .NET Framework 3.0 or in .NET Framework 3.5

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\tspring
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Netlogon has failed an authentication request for a user account. The request timed out before it could be sent to a domain controller. This event indicates that this is the first failure. If the problem continued more events would appear. This failure is commonly referred to as a MaxConcurrentApi failure.
If there are additional failures then more events will be in the event log, and more warning notification from diagnostics.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: MaxConcurrentApi NTLM Authentication Bottleneck Event Detected!

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\tspring
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Netlogon has failed many authentication requests in a short time period (default is 5 minutes for this event notification). The requests timed out before they could be sent to a domain controller.
This event indicates a sustained NTLM performance problem that needs to be investigated. These failures will prevent clients from getting access to resources and will appear to the clients as repeated credential prompts, access denied errors or very long waits before access to resources is granted.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: MaxConcurrentApi NTLM Authentication Bottleneck Event Detected!

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\tspring
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
There was an extended wait for a client for an authentication request to a domain controller. This event indicates that it is the first warning. If the problem persists, additional events will be logged and diagnostics notification will warn separately on those events.
These failures will prevent clients from getting access to resources and will appear to the clients as repeated credential prompts, access denied errors or very long waits before access to resources is granted.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: MaxConcurrentApi NTLM Authentication Bottleneck Event Detected!

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\tspring
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
There was an extended wait for authentication from a domain controller. This wait most likely occured for many users.
This event indicates a sustained NTLM performance problem that needs to be investigated. These failures will prevent clients from getting access to resources and will appear to the clients as repeated credential prompts, access denied errors or very long waits before access to resources is granted.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: MaxConcurrentApi NTLM Authentication Bottleneck Event Detected!

RuleObject.AnnotationExpression: (EventLogData.Any(EventID == 1309 && SourceName == "ASP.NET 4.0.30319.0" && Strings.Contains("ERRCA0012") && Strings.Contains("Object being referred to is not locked by any client")))
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events[(Event/System[EventID='1309'] and Event/System/Provider/@Name="ASP.NET 4.0.30319.0" and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"ERRCA0012")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"Object being referred to is not locked by any client")])]
RuleObject.symptom: "Object being referred to is not locked by any client" is seen in event log
RuleObject.rootCause: This is a side effect of an ASP.Net session timeout failed request and an expected exception when timeout's occur.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
AppFabric Session Provider may throw the exception of ErrorCode<ERRCA0012>:SubStatus<ES0001>:Object being referred to is not locked by any client. The issue is caused by asp.net execution timeout and cane be resolved by increasing executionTimeout value.
ERRCA0012 was caused by execution timeout. It can be resolved by increasing ASP.NET HTTP runtime executionTimeout in the .config file.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Error "Object being referred to is not locked by any client" in Windows Server AppFabric

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\brianpr
RuleObject.symptom: Event ID 482 - ESE - An error occurred when an attempt to write to a file failed because there is not enough space on a disk
RuleObject.rootCause: This Error event indicates that an unexpected error was encountered while writing to the file specified in the message. ESE error -1808 means that the disk is full (JET_errDiskFull)
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
To resolve this error, do one or more of the following: If the error is -1808, then check to see if the disk where the database or logs reside is full. If it is, determine the root cause of why the disk filled up. Check the file system and ensure that the file system is not FAT32.
For more details and information, see the TechNet article.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Event ID 482 - ESE - Error -1808 (0xfffff8f0) occurred when an attempt to write to a file failed because there is not enough space on a disk

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\cwallen
RuleObject.AnnotationExpression: (EventLogData.Any(EventID == 7024 && SourceName.Contains("Service Control Manager") && Strings.Contains("System Center Management") && Strings.Contains("-2147467259")))
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events[(Event/System[EventID='7024'] and Event/System[contains(Provider/@Name,"Service Control Manager")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"System Center Management")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"-2147467259")])]
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
You may see the following event in the System log when the System Center Management service fails to start:
Log Name: System Source: Service Control Manager Date: 5/15/2012 2:04:57 PM Event ID: 7024 Task Category: None Level: Error Keywords: Classic User: N/A Computer: <computer name> Description: The System Center Management service terminated with service-specific error %%-2147467259.
The root cause is the registry key WindowsAccountLockDownSD at HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\HealthService\Parameters\Management Group\<Management Group Name> is invalid or non-present.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Health Service fails to start with error code -2147467259

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.symptom: Kerberos authentication fails
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Kerberos can fail if the time difference between the IIS server and the DC is >5 minutes as defined in the policy " Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization"
Please correct the time difference between IIS server and DC.
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc738673(v=WS.10).aspx http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff649429.aspx
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Kerberos fails due to Time skew difference with IIS Server and DC

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\cwallen
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events[(Event/System[EventID='10710'] and Event/System/Provider/@Name="Health Service Modules" and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"System.Mom.BackwardCompatibility.CollectScriptGeneratedEvents")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"16B61683-51F2-4210-B5BB-F89435F0F131")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"8007006d")])]
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The following error was found in the Operations Manager event log:
Source: Health Service Modules Event ID: 10710 Level: Error User: N/A Computer: server.contoso.com Description: An error occurred in the script data source for management group '{BAF876CA-FF00-7641-F1A2-07447D7AD7CF}', target computer '{83EEE181-6F10-A5E7-F1A1-6032E73AEEE0}', and data type '{16B61683-51F2-4210-B5BB-F89435F0F131}' in receiving script data (HRESULT 8007006d), the data source will attempt recovery.
One or more workflows were affected by this.
Workflow name: System.Mom.BackwardCompatibility.CollectScriptGeneratedEvents Instance name: server.contoso.com Instance ID: {83EEE181-6F10-A5E7-F1A1-6032E73AEEE0} Management group: MG
To resolve this error, remove the override from the following rule in the MOM 2005 Backward Compatability Management Pack:
Generate service state event data (21207 events) to trigger backward compatibility service state monitoring rules
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Backward Compatibility Data Source Error Found

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\cwallen
RuleObject.AnnotationExpression: (EventLogData.Any(EventID == 33333 && SourceName.Contains("DataAccessLayer") && Strings.Contains("p_ManagedEntityInsert") && Strings.Contains("should not generate data about this managed object")))
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events[(Event/System[EventID='33333'] and Event/System[contains(Provider/@Name,"DataAccessLayer")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"p_ManagedEntityInsert")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"should not generate data about this managed object")])]
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
An event similar to the following was detected in the Operations Manager event log:
Log Name: Operations Manager Source: DataAccessLayer Event ID: 33333 Level: Warning User: N/A Computer: server.contoso.com Description: Data Access Layer rejected retry on SqlError: Request: p_ManagedEntityInsert -- (BaseManagedEntityId=7f1e158c-f541-f37c-e867-18a75ce88679), (TypedManagedEntityId=7f1e158c-f541-f37c-e867-18a75ce88679), (ManagedTypeId=627f4dff-40f7-89d6-6d0d-71102b6e8cea), (FullName=Microsoft.Windows.Cluster:cluster), (Path=), (Name=cluster), (TopLevelHostEntityId=7f1e158c-f541-f37c-e867-18a75ce88679), (DiscoverySourceId=cb0ea37f-6734-552f-3d85-398a50a9223d), (HealthServiceEntityId=7922b0ba-8fcf-e8ad-a4d5-b5bef8cde9a4), (PerformHealthServiceCheck=True), (TimeGenerated=6/19/2012 12:14:51 PM), (IsOptimistic=False), (LifetimeRelationshipId=), (LastModified=1/1/1753 12:00:00 AM), (TypedInstanceInserted=False), (ChangeId=), (RETURN_VALUE=1) Class: 16 Number: 777980008 Message: Health service ( clusternode1.contoso.com ) should not generate data about this managed object ( Microsoft.Windows.Cluster ).
To resolve this error, enable Agent Proxying for the server(s) mentioned in the Message section of the event above.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Agent Proxy not enabled for agent Detected

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\jpoche
RuleObject.symptom: SQL Server has encountered a database consistency error: Msg 605
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Msg 605 was logged in the Windows Application Event Log. This message can indicate a database consistency problem. SQL Server generates a 605 error when it detects that a database page has an allocation unit ID in the page header that does not match the expected allocation unit based on the query. Consider running a full database consistency check (DBCC CHECKDB) to determine the extent of all consistency errors. See the information collected below for the database context for which this error was detected.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: SQL Server has encountered a database consistency error: Msg 605

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\cwallen
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
An event similar to the one below was detected in the Operations Manager Event Log:
Log Name: Operations Manager Source: HealthService Event ID: 15004 Task Category: Pool Manager Level: Error User: N/A Computer: server.contoso.com Description: The pool member no longer owns any managed objects assigned to the pool because half or fewer members of the pool have acknowledged the most recent lease request. The pool member has unloaded the workflows for managed objects it previously owned.
Management Group: MG Management Group ID: {BAF876CA-FF00-7641-F1A2-07447D7AD7CF} Pool Name: All Management Servers Resource Pool Pool ID: {4932D8F0-C8E2-2F4B-288E-3ED98A340B9F} Pool Version: 3935519896089326114 Number of Pool Members: 3 Number of Observer Only Pool Members: 1 Number of Instances: 538
This event could cause an impact to monitoring for objects that are assigned to the resource pool identified in the 15004 event. If the event is only occurring intermittently, please use the suggested solution below. If it is occurring continuously, the below suggestion will not resolve the issue as there are likely more significant problems in the environment.
Suggested Solution:
The process suicide in this case may be due to Lease Grant expiration. Lease grant expiration is the time period equal to lease request period and twice the Network latency. Adjust the values below as per the network latency in the customer's environment.
Increase the Lease Request Period and Network latency value using registry keys below on all the Management Servers in Management group.
reg add "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\HealthService\Parameters\PoolManager" /v "PoolLeaseRequestPeriodSeconds" /t REG_DWORD /d 600 /f
reg add "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\HealthService\Parameters\PoolManager" /v "PoolNetworkLatencySeconds" /t REG_DWORD /d 120 /f
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Pool Member Process Suicide Detected

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom:
Users receive a 503 error in the browser: The server is busy now. Try again later
Resolution: Change the throttling threshold
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: The front-end Web throttling feature is introduced in Microsoft SharePoint Foundation 2010 to keep the server from running out of resources for high-priority server jobs. Throttling monitors performance counters on the server and begins to reject low-priority jobs by returning a 503 error message when the counter values exceed or drop lower than predefined thresholds.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8032 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: To make it easier to target specific information to specific users, Microsoft SharePoint Server administrators can define rules that dynamically compile users into audiences. For example, all salespeople in the company can be compiled into an audience
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
One or more of the audience rules is not correctly defined or the User Profile service cannot access the parameter values for the rule — for example, the information for a particular user is not accessible.
Resolution: Manually compile the audience rule
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5693 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: You apply the hotfix package for SharePoint Server 2010 that is described in Microsoft Knowledge Base article 2281364 or 2352342. If the User Profile Synchronization service is run on the server, you may see this event logged in the Application log
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: These errors do not affect the functionality of the Profile Synchronization feature, and you can safely ignore them. It is possible to work around the issue by deleting and re-creating the User Profile Service application, but be aware that doing this will delete the existing user profile, social tag data, and notes data
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 3 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The User Profile Synchronization service cannot connect to the instance of SQL Server. If the service cannot connect to the instance of SQL Server, user profile synchronization will fail to function
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the database server is running and available, 2) Verify connectivity between the database server and the farm, 3) Verify the User Profile Synchronization service credentials, 4) Verify the database access credentials
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 4 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: After a SharePoint backup, you may notice (via certmgr.msc) that there are multiple ForeFront certificates. There is no harm to your system and these can be safely ignored
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Multiple certificates might be created in the certificate store for Forefront Identity Manager.
Resolution You can delete the extra certificates in certmgr.msc
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 234 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Word Automation Services uses a custom timer job to pull items to be converted from the Word Automation Services database and then assign those items to be converted to individual application servers. If the custom timer job does not run, items to be conve
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Verify that the Word Automation Services timer job is enabled in SharePoint Central Adminstration and that the timer job was provisioned successfully.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 1022 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The Microsoft SharePoint Foundation Tracing (SPTracev4) service is used by Microsoft SharePoint to manage usage log output. When usage logging is turned on, administrators can specify the path that is used to store the usage logs. This log
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The configured log location does not have enough free disk space for logging
Resolution: Free up disk space or relocate the usage log
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 2150 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: SharePoint Foundation cannot log on to SQL Server 2008 by using the specified service account user name and password
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Resolution: Grant correct permissions to the database access account
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 3351 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Microsoft SharePoint Foundation uses Microsoft SQL Server 2008 databases to store most of the content for SharePoint Foundation Web site and configuration settings, and uses a service account to communicate with the database on behalf of a user request. Wh
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Users cannot add or update any content in SharePoint Foundation, or administrators cannot update any SharePoint Foundation settings.
Resolution: Increase the size of the SQL Server database
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 3758 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: When you attempt to manage the User Profile Application via Central Admin on a SharePoint Server 2010 with the User Profile Synchronization service started after an IISReset, this warning is logged in the application log of the SharePoint server
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Network Service account does not have rights to the %programfiles%\Microsoft Office Servers\14.0 folder.
Resolution: Grant the Network Service account read access to the %programfiles%\Microsoft Office Servers\14.0 folder
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 1001 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: When you attempt to manage the User Profile Application via Central Admin on a SharePoint Server 2010 with the User Profile Synchronization service started after an IISReset, this warning is logged in the application log of the SharePoint server
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Network Service account does not have rights to the %programfiles%\Microsoft Office Servers\14.0 folder.
Resolution: Grant the Network Service account read access to the %programfiles%\Microsoft Office Servers\14.0 folder
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 1004 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: When you attempt to manage the User Profile Application via Central Admin on a SharePoint Server 2010 with the User Profile Synchronization service started after an IISReset, this warning is logged in the application log of the SharePoint server
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Network Service account does not have rights to the %programfiles%\Microsoft Office Servers\14.0 folder.
Resolution: Grant the Network Service account read access to the %programfiles%\Microsoft Office Servers\14.0 folder
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 1015 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Microsoft SharePoint Server stores most of the content of the Web application — including site collections, sites, lists, documents, and permissions — in content databases. A single Web application can be associated with one or many content databases
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
SQL Server provides the option of setting a database to read-only mode, in which data can be read from the database but data cannot be added, changed, or removed. If a content database is in read-only mode, you might observe the symptoms described.
Resolution: Set the database to read/write
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 4971 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Users can edit properties in their own profiles, as allowed by the administrator. This event is logged when these changes made by the user (or by another process that has authority to update the profile) cannot be committed to the database.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the database server is running and available, 2) Verify connectivity between the database server and the farm, 3) Verify that the database server is no low on resources
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5188 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: SharePoint Foundation uses a service account to communicate with the database on behalf of a user request. This service account can be either a specific user name and password (domain name and password) or a predefined system account, such as Local System
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the service account to which SharePoint Foundation is set does not have sufficient permissions to the database to which it is trying to connect, or the service account is not set up properly in SharePoint Foundation.
Resolution: Grant correct permissions to the database access account
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5214 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Unified Logging Service (ULS) trace logs contain diagnostic information about what is happening on a SharePoint server. This information can be used to diagnose problems on your server if they occur
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
This error occurs when the tracing service cannot create a new log file
Resolution: This error can occur for multiple reasons. The error number and error description describe the cause of the error in more detail; use the information in the error description to determine the most appropriate troubleshooting steps
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5401 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: A SharePoint timer job creates and schedules the two synchronization jobs that synchronize user profile information between the user profile store and user tables
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The SharePoint timer service does not have sufficient permissions to start the other two timer jobs it schedules or these timer jobs do not exist.
Resolution: Verify the timer jobs by using Central Administration
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5556 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: This alert indicates that the configuration settings of the disk-based cache are not valid
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The configuration settings of the disk-based cache are not valid.
Resolution: Correct the configuration settings in the Web.config file
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5787 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: In Microsoft SharePoint, administrators can create new SharePoint sites. Site owners and — depending on the site settings — site visitors can create subsites. This alert indicates that an attempt to create a new SharePoint site has failed
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either there was a configuration error, the user does not have sufficient permission to create the site, or the user attempted to create a site with a non-valid character in the site name, such as '+'.
Resolution: To determine the specific error, see the exception text in the description. One of the following may resolve the issue: 1) User must request access, or 2) User must use a different URL that does not contain non-valid characters
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6141 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: When using Kerberos v5 authentication, the service account used by the Internet Information Services (IIS) application pool for your Web application must be registered in Active Directory as a Service Principal Name (SPN) on the domain on which the front-e
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The role manager or membership provider specified for a particular Web application may be incorrectly configured.
Resolution: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Verify the authentication mode, 2) Configure Kerberos v5 authentication mode, 3) Configure NTLM authentication mode, 4) Configure Forms or Web Single Sign-On authentication mode
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6143 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The User Profile Synchronization service has experienced a generic, unexpected failure
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
There can be multiple causes, but primarily these events indicate connectivity failures with the User Profile Synchronization service — for example, the SharePoint farm failed to connect to the database for the instance of SQL Server
Resolution: One or more the following may resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the database server is running and available, 2) Verify connectivity between the database server and the farm, 3) Verify the database access credentials
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6301 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: In Windows 2003 and later the contact classes inherit dynamically from the securityPrincipal, where sAMAccountName is defined. In Win2000, dynamic auxiliary classes do not exist. Therefore, the sAMAccountName mapping for the contact class is invalid for Wi
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The forest you are synchronizing with contains a Windows 2000 domain controller
Resolution: Upgrade Windows 2000 domain controllers to Windows 2003 or greater
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6306 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The User Profile Synchronization service has experienced a generic, unexpected failure
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
There can be multiple causes, but primarily these events indicate connectivity failures with the User Profile Synchronization service — for example, the SharePoint farm failed to connect to the database for the instance of SQL Server.
Resolution: One or more the following may resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the database server is running and available, 2) Verify connectivity between the database server and the farm, 3) Verify the database access credentials
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6309 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: To improve the performance of SharePoint, most of the data in the configuration database in SQL Server 2008 is kept in a local file-system cache, called the configuration data cache. SharePoint uses the timer service to keep
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The configuration cache directory has security settings that prevent write access to its contents. Although configuration objects can be updated farm-wide, the objects are not updated locally.
Resolution: Assign sufficient permissions to the configuration data cache
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6395 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Several features of Microsoft SharePoint rely on scheduled background processes called timer jobs. Administrators can configure and schedule timer jobs by using SharePoint Central Administration. When you use the Services on Server page of
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The alternate access mapping specified in the configuration cache was not applied to the IIS settings of the local machine.
Resolution: Complete the alternate access mapping update
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6397 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: This error occurs when an Internet Information Services (IIS) 7.0 application pool used by Microsoft SharePoint attempts to update a file or folder and is denied access because the service account used by the application pool has inadequate
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The service account for the IIS application pool that SharePoint uses does not have appropriate permissions to write to a file or folder in the NTFS file system.
Resolution: Grant correct permissions to the application pool account
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6589 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: When using the Kerberos version 5 authentication protocol, the service account that is used by the Internet Information Services (IIS) application pool for your Web application must be registered in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) as an SPN on the
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The application pool account must be registered as Kerberos
Resolution: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Determine which authentication type the site is using, 2) Register the application pool account as an SPN, 3) Specify membership provider name and a role manager, 4) Edit authentication settings for a zone
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6590 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Microsoft SharePoint sends alerts and other SharePoint Products administration messages by using a Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) mail server. When SharePoint Products are configured to receive incoming e-mail, the SMTP service
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Automatic configuration for incoming e-mail is enabled and the Windows SMTP service is not installed on one or multiple servers, or the Windows SMTP service is not running on one or multiple servers.
Resolution: The SMTP server is not installed by default. SMTP can be added by using the Features Summary area of Server Manager in Windows Server 2008 R2. Please configure outgoing e-mail settings in Central Administration, enable and configure the SMTP service, and start the SMTP service
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6599 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: In Microsoft SharePoint, you can bind an event handler to an event host (such as an entire site, a list, or a document library). By binding an event handler to an event host, you can use document library events to start other processes, such as
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either there is a custom event receiver assembly and it cannot be found, or it is corrupted, or the SharePoint assembly cannot be found, or it is corrupted.
Resolution: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Contact the manufacturer of the faulty custom event receiver, 2) Repair your product installation
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6644 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Microsoft SharePoint Foundation requires that specific permissions be set on the Product Help Library to correctly display Help to users. The Product Help Library is located in the Help Site Collection under the SharePoint Central Administration Web applic
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
There was a problem with refreshing permissions for the Product Help Library Site Collection
Resolution: Reset permissions using psconfig (psconfig -cmd helpcollections-install) or via PowerShell (Install-SPHelpCollection -All)
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6769 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Microsoft SharePoint sends alerts and other administration messages by using an SMTP mail server. You can specify which SMTP server to use to send the alerts, and you can set the e-mail address to use for sending alerts and receiving replie
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either Microsoft SharePoint cannot connect to the SMTP host, or SharePoint cannot resolve the name of the outbound SMTP server.
Resolution: You must be a member of the Farm Administrators SharePoint group to perform the following actions: 1) Start and configure the SMTP service, 2) Configure outgoing e-mail settings in Central Administration, 3) Verify that an e-mail alert is sent
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6856 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Microsoft SharePoint sends alerts and other administration messages by using an SMTP mail server. You can specify which SMTP server to use to send the alerts, and you can set the e-mail address to use for sending alerts and receiving replie
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either Microsoft SharePoint Foundation cannot connect to the SMTP host, or SharePoint Foundation cannot resolve name of the outbound SMTP server.
Resolution: You must be a member of the Farm Administrators SharePoint group to perform the following actions: 1) Start and configure the SMTP service, 2) Configure outgoing e-mail settings in Central Administration, 3) Verify that an e-mail alert is sent
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6857 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Microsoft SharePoint sends alerts and other administration messages by using an SMTP mail server. You can specify which SMTP server to use to send the alerts, and you can set the e-mail address to use for sending alerts and receiving replie
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either Microsoft SharePoint Foundation cannot connect to the SMTP host, or SharePoint Foundation cannot resolve name of the outbound SMTP server.
Resolution: You must be a member of the Farm Administrators SharePoint group to perform the following actions: 1) Start and configure the SMTP service, 2) Configure outgoing e-mail settings in Central Administration, 3) Verify that an e-mail alert is sent
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6858 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The Microsoft SharePoint Products incoming e-mail service processes e-mail messages to be added to SharePoint lists. The service processes mail that the Windows Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) service added to a drop folder
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the SharePoint timer service does not have read permissions on the drop folder, the specified drop folder specified doesn't exist, or, the SharePoint timer service does not have write permissions on the drop folder.
Resolution: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Configure the drop directory in IIS, 2) Configure the incoming email settings
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6872 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The Microsoft SharePoint e-mail service processes e-mail destined for insertion into SharePoint lists. The service processes mail that the Windows Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) service added to a drop folder
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either there is no corresponding SharePoint list for the recipient of an e-mail, or the sender does not have sufficient permissions to add content to the SharePoint list.
Resolution: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the list is configured to receive e-mail, 2) Grant the sender the appropriate permissions to the recipient list
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6873 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.symptom: In Microsoft SharePoint, you can bind an event handler to an event host (such as an entire site, a list, or a document library). By binding an event handler to an event host, you can use document library events to start other processes, such as
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either a custom event receiver assembly cannot be found, or it is corrupted, or The SharePoint assembly cannot be found, or it is corrupted.
Resolution: 1) Contact the manufacturer of the faulty event receiver, 2) Repair your product installation
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6875 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: When you back up a Web application, you back up the content databases and settings for the Web application, including all sites in the site collections, files in document libraries, files attached to lists, security and permission settings, and feature se
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
An existing backup/restore timer job has failed or was not fully completed, and the SharePoint Timer Service or SharePoint Admin Service are not started.
Resolution: Verify that the Timer and SharePoint Administration services are running. Next, verify that the previous backup or restore job completed successfully
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 7035 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Word Automation Services includes a default converter for converting files to the XPS file format. In addition to this default converter, third-party converters can be used with Word Automation Services. When third-party converters cause file conversions t
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
A third party XPS convert is out of date, or corrupted.
Resolution: Verify that the latest version of the converter is installed and update the Word Automation Services (http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff808318.aspx)
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8005 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Periodically, Microsoft releases updates for Word Automation Services. These updates help ensure that Word Automation Services can convert newly created files with the best possible quality
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
A file submitted for conversion was created with a newer version of Microsoft Word than the current Word Automation Services converter.
Resolution Update Word Automation Services (http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff808318.aspx)
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8010 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The logging folder specified in the error message does not exist or cannot be accessed
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the folder does not exist, or the SharePoint Tracing Service (SPTraceV4) account does not have permissions to read and write to this folder
Resolution: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the usage logging folder exists, 2) Verify that the SharePoint Tracing Service (SPTraceV4) account has read, write, and delete permissions to the folder
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8074 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The Usage Data Processing timer job failed
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Usage Data Processing timer job failed.
Resolution: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Verify that usage logging is running on all servers in the farm, 2) Verify that usage logging folder exists, 3) Verify that the logging database exists, 4) Rerun the timer job
Information Collected: Detail: %Detail%
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8075 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The managed metadata service provides access to one term store and the term sets that it contains, or it provides content types from a content type syndication hub
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
This can occur if the server is offline or the managed metadata service is not started or has been disabled. The service might not start if the application pool account does not have sufficient permissions to the term store.
Resolution: Verify the application pool account permissions
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8088 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The Security Token service (STS) experienced an error.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
An error occurred with the claims provider that is specified in the exception description
Resolution: Disable the claims provider that caused the error and contact the manufacturer of the claims provider for help resolving the error.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8307 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-bemuel
RuleObject.symptom: When submitting an InfoPath 2010 form to a SharePoint 2010 Form Library “There has been an error while processing the form”. See the KB article for additional symptoms http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2597144
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: An error may be received by users when submitting an InfoPath 2010 form to a SharePoint 2010 Form Library “There has been an error while processing the form”. Event Viewer gives the error: “The control must be in the control tree of a page”
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5374 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: PerformancePoint Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server uses an unattended service account for data connectivity integration. PerformancePoint Services uses this account to access data sources on behalf of the user who is running or creating a dashbo
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
PerformancePoint Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server uses an unattended service account for data connectivity integration. PerformancePoint Services uses this account to access data sources on behalf of the user who is running or creating a dashboard. When the user creates a data source and does not select Per-user Identity for authentication, the data source connection will run as the unattended service account.
Resolution: Confirm the unattended service account settings and the application pool account
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve

PerformancePoint Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server uses an unattended service account for data connectivity integration. PerformancePoint Services uses this account to access data sources on behalf of the user who is running or creating a dashboard. When the user creates a data source and does not select Per-user Identity for authentication, the data source connection will run as the unattended service account.
Resolution: Confirm the unattended service account settings and the application pool account
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Access Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server maintains query results in a session on the Access Services back-end server computer. The issue in this case is that the Access Services server computer failed to create a session for caching query result
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Access Services applications that run on the server might not be able to display data in forms, reports, or the table view
Resolution: Restart the Access Services computer
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 11 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve

RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
One or more of the following symptoms might appear:1.) Access applications in the Web browser time out or respond very slowly, 2.) Users cannot load or view their Access Services applications in the browser
Resolution: Restart the Access Services computer
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 16 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Access Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server depends on a critical DLL file, ascalc.dll, to enable caching of session information and queries
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Access Services fails to start or fails to create Access Services applications
Resolution: Run a repair install for SharePoint
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 17 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Access Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server creates Web sites, which are a representation of Access Services in SharePoint applications on the server. Access Services tried to create an Access Services application on the Web, but encountered an error.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Reinstall the user-defined template, 2) Reinstall templates included with Access Services
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 21 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: As the crawler searches content to create an index, it creates files in a temporary location. This temporary location can grow in size over time. The disk where the temporary location is located is running out of space
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: This is most likely due to the disk on which search crawler creates temporary file running out of space

RuleObject.symptom: The front-end Web application made a request to a specific Access Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server back-end server computer and encountered an unexpected exception. This can indicate an intermittent problem or a problem with a specific server config
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Access Services in SharePoint server computer is in an unstable state and might need to be restarted.
Resolution: Restart the Access Data Services server
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 24 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Access Services in SharePoint server computer is in an unstable state and might need to be restarted
Resolution: Restart the Access Data Services server

RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Access Services in SharePoint server computer is in an unstable state and might need to be restarted.
Resolution: Restart the Access Data Services server
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 26 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.symptom: The front end Access application sent a request to a specific Access Services server computer and encountered an unexpected exception. This can indicate an intermittent problem or a problem with the server computer. In these cases, the front end Access app
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
One or more of the following might be the cause: - The front end Access application encountered an intermittent failure when it sent a request to the Access Services server computer. - The specific Access Services server computer is in an invalid state and must be restarted. - There are network related failures that are preventing the server that is running the front-end Access application from contacting the Access Services server computer
Resolution: Restart the Access Services server computer
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 28 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Access Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server stores its settings in the Microsoft SharePoint Server configuration database. Either a web front end or a back end server component of Access Services was unable to read its settings from the configuration.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Ensure there is a default proxy for Access Services. If that does not resolve the issue, then Re-provision Access Services
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 33 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Access Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server stores its settings in the Microsoft SharePoint Server configuration database. Either a web front end or a back end server component of Access Services was unable to read its settings from the config
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Check permissions for the access services account, and ensure there is a default proxy for Access Services
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 34 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve

RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Ensure there is a default proxy for Access Services. If that does not resolve the issue, then Re-provision Access Services
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 35 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.symptom: Access Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server stores its settings in the Microsoft SharePoint Server configuration database. Either a web front end or a back end server component of Access Services was unable to read its settings from the config
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Ensure there is a default proxy for Access Services. If that does not resolve the issue, then Re-provision Access Services
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 36 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The unattended service account is set to an account that is not valid or is configured incorrectly, or the Secure Store is not accessible
Resolution: Confirm the unattended service account settings and the application pool account
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 37 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.symptom: The PerformancePoint Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server service is unavailable
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The unattended service account is set to an account that is not valid or is configured incorrectly, or the Secure Store is not accessible
Resolution: Confirm the unattended service account settings and the application pool account

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: PerformancePoint Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server uses an unattended service account for data connectivity integration. PerformancePoint Services uses this account to access data sources on behalf of the user who is running or creating a dashboard.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The unattended service account is set to an account that is not valid or is configured incorrectly, or the Secure Store is not accessible.
Resolution: Confirm the unattended service account settings and the application pool account.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 45 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: To support high availability, we recommend that multiple query components be created in the same query group. If a query component fails, the Microsoft Search Server 2010 service (OSearch) relegates the operations of the failed component to another query c
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more of the following solutions may resolve the issue: 1) Restart the search service (net stop osearch14 then net start osearch14), 2) Add a new query component via the Central Administration site
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 58 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: In scenarios where a query component has no mirror and lacks high-availability, or all query components in a query group fail, it is possible that query results will not be served for a portion of the index
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more of the following solutions may resolve the issue: 1) Restart the search service (net stop osearch14 then net start osearch14), 2) Add a new query component via the Central Administration site
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 60 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: As the crawler searches content to create an index, it creates index files to use for retrieving search results. As more items are indexed, the index files grow in size
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more following solutions may resolve the issue: 1) Reclaim disk space for a crawl component, 2) Gain disk space by moving the query component index, 3) Gain disk space by adding another index partition on a new application server
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 80 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: As the crawler searches content to create an index, it creates index files to use for retrieving search results. These files are created by the crawl component in its storage area, and then propagated to the appropriate query components
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Make sure the search service credentials are up to date by rebooting the servers that had the problem, 2) Correct any network connection issues, 3) Create a new query component
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 92 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: A search administration component is created for each search service application. The search administration component modifies search application settings
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more of the following may resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the search service application server can write to the database, 2) Create a new search administration component
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 121 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.symptom: The server for Excel Services Application is responsible for loading, refreshing, and recalculating workbooks, and maintaining user session state. An unexpected internal error was encountered by the server for Excel Services Application
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Excel Services Application server experienced an unexpected failure
Resolution: Restart the Excel Services Application server
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 2026 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: A content deployment job has failed. Content might not have been correctly deployed from the source environment to the target environment
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Content deployment can fail for various reasons. The specific reasons for this failure are contained in the content deployment report on the Content Deployment Paths and Jobs page in Central Administration
Resolution: View the content deployment job status, correct any issues, and rerun the content deployment job
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 4958 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Excel Services Application saves the workbooks it loads to a temporary cache on disk. In this case, a workbook disk cache cannot be created on the Excel Services Application server computer
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Excel workbook disk cache cannot be created
Resolution: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the server computer is functioning and has sufficient disk space, 2) Verify that the account that runs Excel Services Application can create a Temp folder, 3) Verify permissions on the workbook cache location, 4) Delete old Excel Services Application folders in the workbook cache directory, so that the cache can be recreated, 5) Perform an IISReset operation to restart the service

RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the Excel Services Application server computer is turned off or is off the network, or the Excel Services Application server computer is having difficulty and is unavailable
Resolution: Ensure the server is started and can connect to the network

RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the Excel Services Application server computer is turned off or is off the network, or the Excel Services Application server computer is having difficulty and is unavailable.

RuleObject.SolutionDescription: One or more of the following might resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the service application instance is running on the server, 2) Restart the Excel Services Application server, 3) Verify that the proxy for the service application is the default member for the Excel Services Application
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5234 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve

RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Excel Services Application server computer is in a non-valid state and may need to be restarted

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The front-end Web application made a request to a specific server for Excel Services Application and encountered an unexpected exception. This could indicate an intermittent problem or a problem with the specific server computer. In such a case, the Web fr
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The Excel Services Application server computer is in a non-valid state and may need to be restarted.
Resolution: Restart the server running Excel Services Appilcation
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5240 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.symptom: The application server for Excel Services Application failed to access the configuration database and might not be able to read or save any settings. All settings for Excel Services Application are stored in the configuration database
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The configuration database might be offline or unavailable, or permissions on the configuration database have changed, or permissions for the application pool account in which Excel Services Application runs have changed, and Excel Services Application no longer has access to the configuration database.
Resolution: Grant correct permissions to the database access account
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5244 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The server for Excel Services Application is responsible for loading, refreshing, and recalculating workbooks, and maintaining user session state. The server for Excel Services Application failed to allocate memory
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the server for Excel Services Application has reached capacity and the server cannot allocate more memory resources, or the server for Excel Services Application has experienced an unexpected failure and cannot allocate new memory.
Resolution: Evaluate whether the servers are sufficient to support the user load and restart the Excel services Application server computer
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5256 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Excel Services Application supports the defining of load balancing between the Web application front end and the server for Excel Services Application. An option for load balancing is Local. However, this is a valid setting only if the Web front end and th
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The load-balancing scheme is set to Local but Excel Services Application is not running on that Web front end computer.
Resolution: Change the load balancing scheme
