RuleObject.symptom: A content deployment job has failed. Content might not have been correctly deployed from the source environment to the target environment
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Content deployment can fail for various reasons. The specific reasons for this failure are contained in the content deployment report on the Content Deployment Paths and Jobs page in Central Administration
Resolution: View the content deployment job status, correct any issues, and rerun the content deployment job
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5325 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Users who design InfoPath form templates can add managed code to their forms. Errors can occur when this custom code is executed
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the business logic is running in an infinite loop, or the number of business logic calls for a single update in the data exceeded the maximum limit
Resolution: Correct the custom code and attempt the operation again
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5340 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Users who design InfoPath form templates can add managed code to their forms. Errors can occur when this custom code is executed
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Unhandled business logic exception occurred during form load time.
Resolution: Correct the custom code and attempt the operation again
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5343 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: InfoPath Forms Services includes a file named ifsFileNames.xml. This file contains pointers to downloadable files, such as scripts and images for forms
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the ifsFileNames.xml file is missing or is not valid on one or more front-end Web servers in the farm, or Internet Information Services (IIS) is not configured correctly.
Resolution: Run the Office Server Setup and select the repair option. Check the Internet Information Services configuration
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5369 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Some form actions, such as running business logic, switching views, or submitting the form, require a postback to the server. An error occurred when this postback was processed by InfoPath Forms Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2010
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
An internal server error occurred.
Resolution: Verify that there are no issues with the InfoPath form. Restart the InfoPath Forms Service
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5374 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: A user has exceeded the threshold that was set for the number of postbacks allowed per form session. When this condition occurs, the user session is stopped to protect the server
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either a user has tried a denial of service (DoS) attack against a server on which InfoPath Forms Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server runs, or the number of postbacks allowed per InfoPath form session state is too low
Resolution: Check the server logs for signs of a DoS attack. If no evidence is found, consider increasing the number of postbacks allowed per session
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5736 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: A user has exceeded the threshold set for the number of form actions allowed per postback. When this occurs, InfoPath Forms Services terminates the user session in order to protect the server
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
A user has tried a denial of service (DoS) attack against a server on which InfoPath Forms Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server runs.
Resolution: The number of postbacks allowed per InfoPath form session state is too low
Check the server logs for signs of a DoS attack. If no evidence is found, consider increasing the number of postbacks allowed per session
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5737 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: InfoPath Forms Services in Microsoft SharePoint form templates can contain connections to external data sources. An error can occur if the security settings are not configured to allow connections to data sources on different domains
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the form template security level is not set to full trust, the form template data connections are not defined in a data connection file, or cross-domain data access for user form templates is disabled in SharePoint Central Administration.
Resolution: Follow the guidance offered in the description portion of the event in the application event log
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6932 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The Secure Store service application connects to the credential database for reading or writing credentials. This event is logged when the service application fails to connect to the database. The SQL Server exceptions are not logged immediately; the syste
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The database server is down or not accessible because of network issues, the Secure Store service application database connection information is incorrect, or the Secure Store service application metadata database was not provisioned correctly
Resolution: Verify that the Secure Store service application server is available
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 7551 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: If the Secure Store service application is enabled on more than one Microsoft SharePoint Server application server, the client computers will not be affected. If the service is not enabled on more than one application server, the client computers that
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the application server is down or is not accessible due to network issues, or the Secure Store service application is not provisioned correctly
Resolution: Verify that the Secure Store application server is available
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 7557 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: InfoPath Forms Services is not functional because the Microsoft SharePoint Server State Service configuration is not valid
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The State Service, an InfoPath Forms Services dependency, is not configured correctly or is not associated with the Web application that hosts InfoPath forms.
Resolution: One or more of the following may resolve the issue: 1) Create a State Service application by using Windows PowerShell, 2) Associate a State Service proxy with the Web application, 3) Create a State Service application by using the Farm Configuration Wizard
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 7898 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The server for Excel Services Application is responsible for loading, refreshing, and recalculating workbooks, and maintaining user session state. A workbook loaded on Excel Services Application caused a null access violation
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
A workbook with malformed input was loaded on the server
Resolution: Correct the workbook and attempt the operation again
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 7926 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The server for Excel Services Application is responsible for loading, refreshing, and recalculating workbooks, and maintaining user session state. A workbook that was loaded on Excel Services Application caused an access violation that was not null. These
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
A workbook with malformed input was loaded on the server
Resolution: Correct the workbook and attempt the operation again
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 7927 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: An error occurred that caused Visio Services in Microsoft SharePoint Server to fail to generate a diagram. This rule is triggered when the service does not generate a diagram, and can be triggered together with any of the other rules for Visio Service
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Visio Services might be configured incorrectly
Resolution: Verify that diagram is capable of being rendered and try operation again
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8043 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The Business Data Connectivity service runtime reads the metadata defined in the service application model, establishes a connection with the external data source, and calls the appropriate methods defined in the application model for any of the operation
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Either the Business Data Connectivity service application model does not have the correct connection properties for the external data source, or the external data source is currently not functioning and is not responding.
Resolution: One or more of the following may resolve the issue: 1) Verify that the external data source connection properties are correct, 2) Verify that the network connection to external database source is working
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 8080 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Access Services does not render any data in forms, reports, or any other view of an Access application in the browser
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: A front-end Access application server cannot locate or send requests to any server computer that is running Access Services. The Acces Services server is required to query data that is typically used in Access Services reports. Please refer to the provided TechNet article for more details and possible solutiosn for this problem.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 29 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Access Services in SharePoint might not start, Access Services might fail to create Access Services applications, orr users might not be able to view applications in their browsers.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: The configuration database might be experiencing a failure, permissions might have changed for the account that runs the application pool that Access Services is running, so Access Services no longer has access to the SharePoint Confuguration database, or an unexpected failure occurred during provisioning of the service.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 32 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: User sessions are dropped on Excel Services Application. This causes a workbook in the browser to stop responding or causes an error message to appear; for example, An error has occurred.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: A workbook file that is in a corrupted state was loaded on the Excel Services Application server
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presense of Event ID 5225 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Poor performance is occuring for an ASP.NET 2.0 Web application.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: This problem occurs because multiple threads try to access Web browser properties at the same time. Therefore, a deadlock occurs.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 2262 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: You recieve the error 'The search application on server did not finish loading' when accessing search administration links, such as content sources, or crawl logs.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: The search service account has insufficient permissions on a resource. Verify that no group policies have been applied to the local user groups 'WSS_WPG', and 'WSS_ADMIN_WPG'.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 25 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The problem is caused by an inability of the worker process to use the Microsoft.Sharepoint.dll assembly
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: The problem is caused by an inability of the worker process to use the Microsoft.Sharepoint.dll assembly. When the process starts , it will attempt to load and register the needed COM assemblies .If for some reason the operation fails, the assemblies are not loaded in the COM cache. Futher, when we attempt to use them, we cannot find the assembly in the cache, hence we fail when calling the method.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6631 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: The object cache is used internally to optimize page rendering by storing properties of sites, page layouts, and pages. The object cache reduces the amount of traffic between the Web server and a SQL database. This results in higher throughput of rendered.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The super user account utilized by the cache is not configured. This can increase the number of cache misses, which causes the page requests to consume unneccesary system resources.
To configure the account use the following command 'stsadm -o setproperty -propertyname portalsuperuseraccount -propertyvalue account -url webappurl'. The account should be any account that has Full Control access to the SharePoint databases but is not an application pool account.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 7362 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: There is inconsistant user profile data in the content database. User profile data does not get synchronized because of this inconsistancy.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
You can use stsadm to list information about the databases that haven't been synchronized with the user profile service.
stsadm -o sync -listolddatabases n stsadm -o sync -deleteolddatabases n where 'n' is how many days have passed since the databases have been synchronized
These commands will delete the synchronization references in the configuration databases, so that when a new profile synchronization occurs, new references will be stored in the database.
You must run the stsadm shell as the farm account for the previous commands to work successfully.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5553 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: User profile data is failing to synchronize between the User Profile Service, and a web application.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: There was a failure trying to synch user profiles with a web application. This event is most commonly thrown when there is a conflict between the timer job "Timer Service Recycle", and 'User Profile Quick Synchronization". It is recommended to set the "Timer Service Recycle" job to run during off peak hours.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 5555 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: You are running profile synchronization (using Forefront Identity Manger) in SharePoint Server. Profile synchronization fails and the Event ID 6801 is logged to the Event Viewer.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
This problem may occur if the proxy for user profile service application becomes corrupt or gets deleted.
In order to address this problem, delete and re-create the user profile service application proxy by using the following Powershell commands:
a) Remove the user profile service application proxy:
$proxy = Get-SPServiceApplicationProxy | where {$_.typename -eq "User Profile Service Application Proxy"} Remove-SPServiceApplicationProxy -Identity $proxy -confirmfalse
b) Create the user profile service application proxy:
$upa = Get-SPServiceApplication | where {$_.name -eq "<name here>"} New-SPProfileServiceApplicationProxy -Name<proxyName> -Uri $upa.uri.absoluteURI
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 6801 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: After a SharePoint backup, you may notice (via certmgr.msc) that there are multiple ForeFront certificates. There is no harm to your system and these can be safely ignored
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Multiple certificates might be created in the certificate store for Forefront Identity Manager.
Resolution You can delete the extra certificates in certmgr.msc
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 234 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\cwallen
RuleObject.rootCause: This issue occurs because the ReceiveMessage method in the DuplexSessionReceiveMessageAndVerifySecurityAsyncResult object does not catch exceptions that are caused by the error, and they are transferred to the user thread.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
You receive an event similar to the following in the Operations Manager event log on the RMS
Log Name: Operations Manager Source: OpsMgr SDK Service Date: 21.12.2012 12:06:04 Event ID: 26380 Task Category: None Level: Error Keywords: Classic User: N/A Computer: RMS.SERVER.COM Description: The System Center Operations Manager SDK Service failed due to an unhandled exception. The service will attempt to restart. Exception: System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException: The socket connection was aborted. This could be caused by an error processing your message or a receive timeout being exceeded by the remote host, or an underlying network resource issue. Local socket timeout was '10675199.02:48:05.4775807'. ---> System.IO.IOException: The read operation failed, see inner exception. ---> System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException: The socket connection was aborted. This could be caused by an error processing your message or a receive timeout being exceeded by the remote host, or an underlying network resource issue. Local socket timeout was '10675199.02:48:05.4775807'. --->
The solution for this issue is to install the hotfix from KB 2600907
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: SDK System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException due to KB 2600907

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\cwallen
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
On all management servers in the All Management Servers Resource Pool:
Make a backup of x:\Program Files\System Center 2012\Operations Manager\Server\ConfigService.Config
Open ConfigService.config in notepad and edit the following values:
-Change <OperationTimeout DefaultTimeoutSeconds="30"> to 300 seconds -Change <Operation Name="GetEntityChangeDeltaList" TimeoutSeconds="180" /> to 300 seconds.
Restart the Configuration Service
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Config Service DeltaSynchronization process fails with timeout exception

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\scotto
RuleObject.symptom: Problem described in the article
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Super Rule for CSV volume goes offline on backup on Windows Server 2012
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Virtual machine enters a paused state or a CSV volume goes offline

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\timmac
RuleObject.AnnotationExpression: (EventLogData.Any(EventID == 6025 && SourceName == "PCNSSVC" && Strings.Contains("target could not be authenticated")))
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events[(Event/System[EventID='6025'] and Event/System/Provider/@Name="PCNSSVC" and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"target could not be authenticated")])]
RuleObject.symptom: PCNS is failing, and is not reaching the Synchronization Service machine. It is throwing an error with the Event ID 6025 in the Application Event Log.
RuleObject.rootCause: The SPN set on the Synchronization Service Account does not match that specified in the PCNS Configuration File
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
PCNS is failing with the event text:
The password change notification target could not be authenticated.
User Action: This usually happens under the following conditions: 1. The Service Principal Name (SPN) for the target has not been assigned to the Active Directory account used to host the target process. 2. The SPN is assigned to more than one Active Directory account. 3. The SPN is not properly formatted. The SPN must use the fully qualified domain name of the target system. 4. There is more than 5 minutes of time variance between this system and the target system.
Please verify that the SPN configuration and that the clocks on the two systems are synchronized to an authoritative time source.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Event ID: 6025 - Problem with the Service Principal Name

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\timmac
RuleObject.symptom: Receive Event ID 6025 in the Application Event Log on the Domain Controller when attempting to initiate a PCNS password reset
RuleObject.rootCause: Not able to make a RPC Connection to the Synchronization Service Machine
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
This version of the Event ID 6025 event message is an indication that we cannot make a successful RPC connection to the Synchronization Service machine from the Source Domain Controller where the Password Change Notification Service (PCNS) is installed.
The focus for troubleshooting this Event ID 6025 with the status of 1753 should be around network connectivity between the Source Domain Controller and the Synchronization Service machine.
A few key things to remember:
è Ensure that you have enabled Password Synchronization
è PCNS utilizes Kerberos to be able to reset the password, so there must be SRV record access between the Source Domain Controller and the Synchronization Machine.
è If you have a firewall between the Source Domain Controller and the Synchronization Machine, ensure that you have all the necessary ports open.
?This includes the Windows Firewall.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Event ID: 6025 - Status 1753 - There are no more endpoints available from the endpoint mapper

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\brianpr
RuleObject.OPNExpression: /Events[(Event/System[EventID='3'] and Event/System/Provider/@Name="System.ServiceModel 3.0.0.0" and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"System.ServiceModel.ServiceActivationException")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"Method not found")] and Event/EventData/Data[contains(.,"System.String System.ServiceModel.Activation.Iis7Helper.ExtendedProtectionDotlessSpnNotEnabledThrowHelper(System.Object)")])]
RuleObject.symptom: WCF services that are hosted on IIS on Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 may receive an exception error message after you install an update for the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 for WCF
RuleObject.rootCause: This problem occurs because the computer may have some hotfixes installed that contained only System.ServiceModel.dll and not System.ServiceModel.WasHosting.dll.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
To work around this issue, make sure that the versions of System.ServiceModel.dll and System.ServiceModel.WasHosting.dll are in sync.
To resolve this issue, install update 2637518
or any .NET Framework 3.0 SP2 hotfix that contains both assemblies.
We recommend that you install update 2637518 to resolve this issue. Apply this hotfix only to systems that are experiencing this specific problem.
For more information and details, see KB 2801728
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: WCF services that are hosted on IIS on Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 may receive an exception error message after you install an update for the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 for WCF

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\timmac
RuleObject.symptom: Upgrading from FIM 2010 to R2 may encounter a problem upgrading the FIM Service. The FIM Service upgrade fails with a "Service 'Forefront Identity Manager Service' (FIMService) failed to start. Verify that you have sufficient privileges to start system ser
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
The default timeout is 30 seconds. Setting this timeout to 60 seconds has resolved several issues with this error. The timeout may be related to .NET verifying the Authenticode signatures in the FIM Service code. Please see FIM Troubleshooting: FIM Service Start-up Timeout.
To change the timeout please add the following registry value on the FIM Service server and reboot.
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control Name: ServicesPipeTimeout Type: REG_DWORD Value (decimal): 60000
For more information on ServicesPipeTimeout please see the link on Event ID 7009 .
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Error 1920. Service 'Forefront Identity Manager Service' (FIMService) failed to start.

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.symptom: Error in Event Log and Deployment Log
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
SCCM runs under machine account and we do not provide machine account access to SSO store. We are explicitly restricting machine account for security reasons since SSO access checking has to meet certain windows security requirements and it’s not allowed to provide machine account with access to SSO Store. There is no plan to change this behavior.
You will also see the error Error message in deployment log file: "Error: Failed to update binding information. Could not store transport type data for Primary Transport of Send Port 'SendPasswordSendPort' to config store. Access denied. See the event log (on computer 'SAXOVM032') for more details "
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: SCCM cannot run under machine account to automate BizTalk application deployment

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.rootCause:
Registry and or file system permissions may have been changed from their defaults.
The "All Application Packages" group (a well known group with a predefined SID) must have specific access to certain locations of the registry and file system for Moder
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Modern Apps fail to open.
Specifically, clicking on the tile of a Modern app will begin to launch the application but the app simply returns the user to the start screen. No on-screen error is displayed.
Resolution:
First, please check if the fix in KB 2776798 has been installed.
Registry and File System permission must be reverted back to a state that will allow modern applications to function. Follow this method to resolve the issue
1. Determine if file system permissions have been changed. If not see the "More Information" section below 2. If so how were they changed? Manually or with Group Policy? 3. Determine if registry permissions have been changed If not see the "More Information" section below 4. If so how were they changed? Manually or with Group Policy?
Please refer to KB 2798317 for more details.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Win8: App: Modern: Apps fail to start if default registry or file permissions modified

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: Search queries, and crawling are unresponsive.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Verify that the server "SharePoint Server Search 14" is started on the server hosting the crawl and query components.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 2587 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\dennim
RuleObject.symptom: Hyper-V VM's will go into a saved state during backups instead of allowing online backups.
RuleObject.rootCause: Online VM backups will fail if scoped snapshots are enabled on the virtual machine.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Add the following value to the registry to disable scoped snapshots.
HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\SystemRestore REG_DWORD ScopeSnapshots 0x0
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Hyper-V VM's will go into a saved state during backups instead of allowing online backups.

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\v-mikeve
RuleObject.symptom: A content deployment job has failed. Content might not have been correctly deployed from the source environment to the target environment.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription: Reasons for the failure can vary. Find the associated error in the application event log to find more information on the error. You might also find details on the deployment job status page as to why this job has failed.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Presence of Event ID 4958 in the Application Event Log

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\jeast
RuleObject.symptom: •The application or service randomly stops responding. •A number of connections appear in the "CLOSE WAIT" state in netstat output and remain in this state until the system is rebooted. •The application or service consumes an unusually high number of han
RuleObject.rootCause: This issue occurs because of a race condition in the TCP/IP driver (tcpip.sys).
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: An application or service that uses Winsock API or Winsock Kernel API may randomly stop responding in Windows Server 2008 R2 or in Windows 7

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\jeast
RuleObject.symptom: Backup failure and the application log containing 517 & 513 error messages
RuleObject.rootCause: The system writer fails because permissions to files in the %windir%\winsxs\filemaps\ or %windir%\winsxs\temp\PendingRenames directories are incorrect.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
When you perform a system state backup using Windows Server Backup on Windows Server 2008, the backup fails with the following error:
Backup of system state failed [01/12/2009 16:21]
Log of files successfully backed up 'C:\Windows\Logs\WindowsServerBackup\SystemStateBackup 01-12-2009 16-21-37.log'
Log of files for which backup failed 'C:\Windows\Logs\WindowsServerBackup\SystemStateBackup_Error 01-12-2009 16-21-37.log'
System writer is not found in the backup.
In the Application event log, the following events are logged:
Log Name: Application Source: Microsoft-Windows-Backup Event ID: 517 Level: Error Description: Backup started at '01/12/2009 16:21:03' failed with following error code '2155348226' (System writer is not found in the backup.). Please rerun backup once issue is resolved.
Log Name: Application Source: Microsoft-Windows-CAPI2 Event ID: 513 Level: Error Description: Cryptographic Services failed while processing the OnIdentity() call in the System Writer Object. Details: AddCoreCsiFiles : BeginFileEnumeration() failed. System Error: Access is denied.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Backup fails on windows server 2008 SP2

RuleObject.Creator: NORTHAMERICA\hongweis
RuleObject.symptom: Installation of .NET Framework 4.0, Visual Studio 2010. VC++ 2010 may fail
RuleObject.rootCause: Most of the times these error messages appears if the Certificate Revocation Lists is switched off.
RuleObject.SolutionDescription:
Installation of .NET Framework 4.0, Visual Studio 2010. VC++ 2010 may fail with the error messages related to the certification.
1) Event Type: Error Event Source: VSSetup Event Category: None Event ID: 5000
2) Log file snippet: Verifying Digital Signatures: C:\78c0a6f577e462b6d6\SetupUtility.exe (C:\78c0a6f577e462b6d6\SetupUtility.exe) failed with error 0x800b010e (The revocation process could not continue - the certificate(s) could not be checked.)
Possible Resolution: Most of the times these error messages appears if the Certificate Revocation Lists is switched off.
To switch on the Certificate Revocation Lists please changed the value of the below registry key:
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\WinTrust\Trust Providers\Software Publishing\State The value should be 23c00. State = 0x00023c00 - ‘Check for publisher’s certificate Revocation’ Checked.
RuleObject.SolutionTitle: Unable to Install .NET Framework 4.0, Visual Studio 2010 and VC++ 2010
